answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources that might be helpful as a start to your research.
I have included a list of places with existing library co-operatives. You may want to contact them directly for more information about the success of their programs.
The Mid-Eastern Michigan Library Cooperative
http://www.mmlc.info/ 
This is a list of existing library cooperatives in Florida.
http://dlis.dos.state.fl.us/fgils/mlcs.html 
Here is a similar list from New Hampshire.
http://www.nh.gov/nhsl/lds/cooperatives.html 
I also found some recent news articles about library cooperatives.
The Baldwin County Library Cooperative in Alabama has created an iPhone app for their system.
http://blog.al.com/live/2011/12/baldwin_county_libraries_add_s.html 
This is the mission statement from the Michigan State Library Cooperatives.
http://www.smlc.lib.mi.us/MiCoops.htm 
A group of communities in Michigan is looking to create another cooperative in their area of the state.
http://www.lenconnect.com/news/local_government/x631812748/Libraries-talk-about-joining-together 
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: David Sollenberger
text:
Would like to know of library consultants experienced in evaluating library cooperatives who could make conclusions and recommendations on the following:
1.Evalauation of service areas 
2.Examination of what is working and what is not working about the cooperative
3.Exploring options of a joint taxing district or other mechanisms to fund the cooperative based on costs and benefits of each member
4.Fiscal evaljation
title: Library consultants experienced in evaluating library cooperatives
